metadata.title: CVE-2021-33287 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In NTFS-3G versions < 2021.8.22, when specially crafted NTFS attributes areread in the function ntfs_attr_pread_i, a heap buffer overflow can occurand allow for writing to arbitrary memory or denial of service of theapplication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libntfs-3g88 - 1:2017.3.23-2ubuntu0.18.04.3
ntfs-3g - 1:2017.3.23-2ubuntu0.18.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntfs-3g package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2017.3.23-2ubuntu0.18.04.3').
